def: A plant of the genus Linum, esp. the L. usitatissimum, whichhas a single, slender stalk, about a foot and a half high, with blueflowers. The fiber of the bark is used for making thread and cloth,called linen, cambric, lawn, lace, etc. Linseed oil is expressed fromthe seed.
One who is armed with a target or shield. [Written alsotargetier.]
Arrayed, prepared, or furnished, unsuitably. [Archaic] Bp.Hall.
To mingle; to mix; to unite; to blend. [R.] Thomson.
To yield or make concession.I wished you to concede to America, at a time when she prayedconcession at our feet. Burke.
An adjective suffix signifying action or being; as, corrodent,excellent, emergent, continent, quiescent. See -ant.
The formation of a figure, representation, or semblance; adelineation or description.Some kind of apish imitations, counterfeit iconisms. Cudworth.
Of or relating to Morpheus, to dreams, or to sleep. Keats.
The large, hard-shelled nut of the cocoa palm. It yields anagreeable milky liquid and a white meat or albumen much used as foodand in making oil.
